articles.title: Biden to give voting rights speech in Philadelphia - The Washington Post
articles.description: In a speech Tuesday in Philadelphia, the president underscored how the “denial of the right to vote” is “grounded in autocracy, undemocratic, un-American and unpatriotic,” a White House official said.
articles.content: At the National Constitution Center in Philadelphia, in a room filled with images of Benjamin Franklin and quotes from Daniel Webster and Theodore Roosevelt, Biden compared the new laws to voter supp… [+8392 chars]

articles.description: In a riveting press conference, the world No 8 reveals the origin of his spat with his fellow American – and why they will never be high-fiving each other.
articles.content:
Covid-19 protocols may mean British Open press conferences are limited to 15 minutes, but no one could complain of feeling short-changed by Brooks Koepka.

articles.description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp was cautiously optimistic over the progress made by Virgil van Dijk and three other injured stars, who returned to training on Tuesday after lengthy lay-offs.

articles.title: Una Healy's kids blocked from flying to America to visit dad Ben Foden - Irish Mirror
articles.description: Ben Foden's wife Jackie had flown all the way to Dublin so she could take Aoife and Tadhg back to the States with her to visit their dad, but they weren't allowed to enter the country
articles.content:
